original: Benzow, Bengt Johan Kristofer, lektor, Göteborg, f. 18/3/83 i V. Al-stad, Malmöh. 1. G. 18 m. Ruth Kle-berg. Barn: Jan f. 21, Märta 26. — Stud :ex. i Malmö 02, fil. kand. i Lund 05, fil. Hc. 08, teol. kand. 10, provår i Lund 12-13, disp. f. lektorat 14. Res. t. Tyskl., Schweiz o. Österr. 22, Tyskl., Ö^terr., Tjeckoslov. o. Ital. 24, Tyskl. s. Hvitf :stip. 28, HolL, Belg. o. Frankr. 33. E. lär. v. östra real i Gbg 10-12, v. Gbgs h. real 13-14, vik. lektor i Härnösand 14, adj. i Halm-stad 14, lektor i Gävle 15, lektor i kristend :kunsk, v. Gbgs h. real (Vasa lärov.) sed. 24. Lär. v. Gbgs h. samsk. 25-42, v. Gbgs gymn. f. fl. sed. 26. Insp. f. Sandvikens priv. »samsk. 20-25, sakk. i skol-komm. 21, h. skolisakk, 25, v. ordf. i Gbgs lär:sällsk. 26-27, förest, f. provårskurs 36, insp. f. Mölndals komm. mellansk. 38-43, led. av S :t Johannes kyrkoråd 41, ordf. i komm. f. ungd:-gudstjänst 33-43. Skr.: Om relig. etiska grundval (14), Kristustron i hist. belysn. (19), Idealitet o. -religiositet (21), Livstro o. Gudstro (32), Inför högre rätt (36), Mot ’strömmen (37), I korsets tecken (40), Rehgions-undervisning o. uppfostran (43), Herrens dag (43), En man söker sanningen; (45), medarb. i relig. frågor i ett flert. tidn. o. tidskr., föreläs, i radio om kyrkl. o. relig :vet :skapl. litt. Hobby: trädgårdsodling. RNO, LVVS.
translated: Benzow, Bengt Johan Kristofer, lecturer, Gothenburg, born March 18, 1883 in Västra Alstad, Malmöhus. Married Ruth Kleberg in 1918, with children Jan (born 1921) and Märta (born 1926). Education: graduated from Malmö exam school in 1902, earned Bachelor of Arts degree from Lund University in 1905, Filosofie licentiat (Master of Science) in 1908, earned Bachelor of Theology degree in 1910, spent 1912-13 as a trainee in Lund, and defended his thesis for a lectureship in 1914. Traveled to Germany, Switzerland, and Austria in 1922, Germany, Austria, Czechoslovakia, and Italy in 1924, Germany with a White Cross Scholarship in 1928, the Netherlands, Belgium, and France in 1933. Worked as a teacher at the Eastern Real School in Gothenburg from 1910-1912, taught at Gothenburg High School from 1913-1914, served as substitute lecturer in Härnösand in 1914, as an adjunct in Halmstad in 1914, as a lecturer in Gävle in 1915, and as a lecturer in religious knowledge at Gothenburg High School (Vasa Gymnasium) since 1924. Also taught at Gothenburg Higher Public School from 1925-1942 and at Gothenburg Gymnasium from 1926. Was an inspector for Sandviken's private "samsk." school from 1920-1925, a school committee member in 1921, a high school inspector in 1925, the vice-chairman of the Gothenburg Teachers Society from 1926-1927, and the director of the probationary course in 1936. Was an inspector for Mölndal's municipal middle school from 1938-1943, a member of St. John's Church Council in 1941, the chairman of the committee for youth worship from 1933-1943. Writings include: "On Religious Ethical Foundation" (1914), "Christ's Faith in Historical Light" (1919), "Idealism and Religiousness" (1921), "Belief in Life and Belief in God" (1932), "Before the Higher Court" (1936), "Against the Current" (1937), "In the Sign of the Cross" (1940), "Religious Education and Upbringing" (1943), "The Lord's Day" (1943), and "A Man Seeks the Truth" (1945). Also contributed to various newspapers and magazines on religious issues, and gave lectures on Church and Religious Science on the radio. His hobby was gardening. Awards include: Royal Order of the North Star and the Swedish Society for the Promotion of Literature.

structured.name: Bengt Johan Kristofer Benzow
structured.description: Bengt Johan Kristofer Benzow was a Swedish lecturer born on March 18th, 1883 in Västra Alstad, Malmöhus. He married Ruth Kleberg in 1918 and had two children: Jan (born 1921) and Märta (born 1926). Benzow earned a Studieexamen degree from Malmö exam school in 1902, Bachelor of Arts degree from Lund University in 1905, Filosofie licentiat degree in 1908, and Bachelor of Theology degree in 1910. He worked at various schools and institutions throughout his career. Apart from teaching, he also wrote a number of books and articles on religious issues and participated in radio lectures on Church and Religious Science. He passed away on unknown date.
